intro: Barnebyella, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It consists of a single species, Barnebyella ramosissima, native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit, with woody stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to orange, clustered in racemes, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Barnebyella is adapted to harsh, dry environments, exhibiting deep root systems and drought tolerance.
